#CACM2.0
ACER recommends changes to the capacity calculation process to specify the determination of capacity calculation regions and align the capacity calculation processes and bidding zone review with the Electricity Regulation  (incl. 70% target)

#CACM2.0
ACER recommends to establish a European single legal entity to perform the #market coupling operator‚Äôs tasks within five years after entry into force. https://t.co/sx7uU1tC3C

#CACM2.0
ACER proposes amendments to the current #marketcoupling governance set-up of the #CACM Regulation by introducing a joint decision making body for all TSOs and NEMOs and qualified majority voting for decisions on #marketcoupling‚Ä¶.

urls.title: European Union Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER) | LinkedIn
urls.description: European Union Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER) | 6,541 followers on LinkedIn. ACER is an EU Agency that fosters the completion of a fully integrated European internal energy market | The EU Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER) fosters a fully integrated and well-functioning Internal Energy Market, where electricity and gas are traded and supplied according to the highest integrity and transparency standards, and EU consumers benefit from a wider choice, fair prices and greater protection. The Agency ensures: - a more ‚Äãcompetitive, integrated market, offering consumers more ‚Äãchoice, - an ‚Äãefficient energy infrastructure and networks, enabling energy to move freely across borders, the integration of renewable sources, and therefore ensuring a higher degree of ‚Äãsecurity of supply, - a ‚Äãmonitored and ‚Äãtransparent energy market guaranteeing consumers fair, cost-reflective prices and ‚Äãa limitation of market abusive behaviours. ACER is continuously wor

urls.title: Repurposing existing gas infrastructure to pure hydrogen: ACER finds divergent visions of the future
urls.description: ACER reviewed more than 20 studies focusing on the technical and the cost aspects of repurposing existing gas infrastructure to pure hydrogen and developed a summary paper dwelling on the technical possibilities for repurposing.

text:
‚úîÔ∏èRepurposing to #hydrogen may be dependent on specific #conditions.

Would you like to find out more? Check our #websiteüëá 
https://t.co/wqZFdP0VG4

‚úîÔ∏èDivergent #visions exist of #future extent of #hydrogen #networks, ranging from a large-scale pan-#European #transmission infrastructure based on repurposed natural gas networks to #regional, cluster- based systems that serve hydrogen #supply & #demand in #geographic proximity.

üí°What are the main #findings?

‚úîÔ∏èMost #studies find that #repurposing does not present insurmountable technical #challenges and is cheaper than building new pure #hydrogennetworks.

@eu_acer @Energy4Europe @EU_Commission @csikow @KadriSimson @ENTSO_E @mortenhelveg Hmmm ...
@eu_acer @maurerchr @bnetza @BMWi_Bund Cheers! I look forward to the TSOs' implementation of the action plans!

@eu_acer @CEERenergy @KPurchala @ENTSO_E @Energy4Europe @TimMcPhieEU @mortenhelveg @KadriSimson @csikow 2/2 If the 70% target is not met, it can trigger a BZ split. The problem however is that the BZ review methodology will probably also not be able to steer towards overal market efficiency.

@eu_acer @CEERenergy @KPurchala @ENTSO_E @Energy4Europe @TimMcPhieEU @mortenhelveg @KadriSimson @csikow 1/2 It was an excellent webinar! Txs a lot. 
My two take-aways:
1. ENTSO-E and ACER don't agree on precise application of 70% rule. This is a concern for the market.
2. The 70% is a crowbar. It can be useful, but one has to remember that it is not optimal.

@eu_acer Thanks. Honestly, for me the picture looks biased, at least, if your presentation focuses on targets which will become binding in 2026 only. This somehow suggests non-compliance, which is actually not true (see picture below e.g. for Germany). @bnetza @BMWi_Bund https://t.co/fElP0FMtN8

Our #assessments: #gas prices did not fall simultaneously and equally across all countries. Overall, gas sourcing at most liquid #EU hub #trading venues turned more #competitive than supply from prevailing long term contracts, if those were less hub oriented.
